title: Vivero Irupe - Backend & Admin Panel
description: Comprehensive backend and admin panel for managing an online plant nursery. Includes robust security measures, optimized performance, and a feature-rich interface for product and user management.
what_i_learned: Backend development with Spring Boot and PostgreSQL
JWT authentication with Spring Security
Implementation of caching with Spring Boot and Caffeine
Rate limiting using custom annotations for endpoint protection
Integration with Cloudflare R2 using the S3 API for image storage
Database migrations managed with Flyway
Code simplification with Lombok
Detailed API documentation using Swagger
Frontend development with React and Next.js
Advanced caching and real-time data management with TanStack/React-Query
TailwindCSS for responsive and customizable UI
Middleware protection for secure routes in Next.js

title: Vivero Irupe - Frontend
description: Website for an online plant nursery with over 200 products. Features smooth animations, advanced transitions, and modern rendering techniques for optimal performance. Built with Astro and React, with advanced SEO and email sending capabilities.
what_i_learned: Frontend development with Astro and React
Using TypeScript for safe typing
Implementation of ViewTransitions for smooth animations
Performance optimization by combining SSR, SSG, and CSR
Data management with tanstack/react-query
Integration with a Spring Boot backend for data and functionalities
Cloudflare configuration as a firewall and R2 storage
SEO implementation for better search engine ranking
Using Resend for sending emails
Frontend deployment on Vercel and domain management with Cloudflare

title: Note Creation FullStack
description: Web application for creating notes, with user authentication and email verification. Storage of notes in a PostgreSQL database. Developed with Spring Boot and React.
what_i_learned: FullStack web application with Spring Boot and React
User authentication with Spring Security and JWT
Spring Data JPA for data persistence
Storage of notes in a PostgreSQL database
Route handling implemented with React Router
Dockerizaci√≥n of the application
Migration control with Flyway
Sending emails with JavaMailSender

title: Learn Japanese
description: Interactive learning experience for the Japanese alphabets Hiragana and Katakana.
what_i_learned: Developing a web application with Next.js
Improve my programming skills in TypeScript
Improve my programming skills in Tailwind
Use zustand for global state management
Use shadcn/ui for the application components

title: AI Interview Odyssey
description: Interview Simulator Using InfoJobs and OpenAI APIs.
what_i_learned: Developing a web application with Next.js
Learn to use TypeScript
Learn to use Tailwind
Consumption of third-party APIs.

title: SpringBoot API Forum
description: RESTful API - Built with Spring Boot.
what_i_learned: Development in Spring Framework
Spring Security
Token-based authentication (JWT) and authorization to secure your API.
Data persistence with JPA
API documentation
Handling HTTP Requests and Responses
Error messages and exceptions, and data validation in an API
Migration control with Flyway

title: Alura Hotel
description: The 'Hotel Reservation Management System' is an application designed to facilitate and streamline the management of room reservations in a hotel.
what_i_learned: Mission: create a hotel management system with CRUD functions: Create, Read, Update, and Delete guest records stored in the database.
Adopted a solid Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture for our entities. Additionally, used JavaFX to design an intuitive and user-friendly user interface.
Used the MVC (Model-View-Controller) design pattern to separate the responsibilities of the application into layers.

title: Text Encryption
description: This project was developed as part of a challenge offered by One, in partnership with Oracle. The project involves text encryption developed using web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
what_i_learned: Improve my programming skills in JavaScript.
Improve my programming skills in HTML and CSS.

title: Java Converter
description: This project is a converter that allows the user to perform conversions between different units of measure, such as currency, time, temperature, area, and length. The currency converter uses an external API to obtain updated exchange rates, while time, temperature, area, and length conversions are performed internally within the application.
what_i_learned: Use an external API to obtain updated exchange rates.
Create designs with JavaFX.
Improve my programming skills in Java.

title: Real estate with Next.js 14
description: Test project where I've put into practice my skills with Next14, MySQL, and the next.js API Router, along with their hooks.
what_i_learned: Improve my skills with Next.js 14
API Router of next.js
Hooks of next.js
Connection with MySQL
Improve my skills with React and its hooks
Filter with SearchParams and QueryParams

title: 1st Generation Pokedex
description: Design of the first-generation Pokedex created with CSS and using JavaScript to fetch data from the PokeApi. The 'Astro' framework was used.
what_i_learned: Learn to use the Astro framework.
Improve my programming skills in HTML and CSS.

title: Digital Retouch
description: A page where you can apply filters to images using vanilla JavaScript.
what_i_learned: Improve my programming skills in JavaScript.
Improve my programming skills in HTML and CSS.

title: CV Jensen Ackles
description: A page displaying information about actor Jensen Ackles in the style of a portfolio.

title: Java Calculator
description: Application developed in Java and JavaFX that implements the stack concept for mathematical operations.
what_i_learned: Better understand the stack data structure.
Improve my programming skills in Java.
Learn to program with JavaFX.

title: Matchmatic Android App
description: This is my project as part of the Mobile Application Development Course by Ticma and Argentina Programa 4. As a web developer, this August, I decided to venture into the world of mobile applications, and this is my first step.
what_i_learned: MatchMatic is a simple text comparison application. It allows you to enter two text strings and tells you if they are equal or different. It is developed in Kotlin and follows the MVVM architecture.
Learn to program in Kotlin.
Learn to program in Android Studio.
Learn to use the MVVM architecture.

title: 5 Projects with React

Improve my programming skills in React.
Learn to use vitest and test components.
Improve my programming skills in JavaScript.
